channel.title: R on Ten thousand words...

item.title: Dynamic Docs in R (part 1)
item.description: A brief intro to dynamic documents in R I was asked to give a short overview of dynamic documents in R during Dr. Cini Brown’s lab meeting at Colorado State University last week, and I thought I would post some of the material here as well. What is a dynamic document? Dynamic documents, or living documents, are documents which can be continuously updated, and are often self-contained. This means that the document itself contains the framework to generate and update its content.
